Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a tic-tac-toe game.
    Author:
    Riley Olds

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) char[][] board  
      (package private) int boardSize
      represents the board as a 2d matrix of symbols.
      (package private) char SYMBOL_BLANK
      represents board size, which will be the size of both dimensions of the board.
      (package private) char SYMBOL_CPU
      symbol for the human player's spaces.
      (package private) char SYMBOL_HUMAN
      symbol for blank spaces.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoardSize

        public int getBoardSize()
        Returns the game board size.
        Returns:
        the size of the board

      • isValidMove

        public char isValidMove​(Move move)
        Checks the validity of given move.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be validated.
        Returns:
        'V' if the move is valid, or a different character depending on why it is invalid.

      • executeMove

        protected boolean executeMove​(Move move,
                              char symbol)
        Executes the move passed. If the move is invalid it returns false.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be executed.
        symbol - the symbol of the player making the move.
        Returns:
        true if the move was successfully executed.

      • getGameStatus

        public char getGameStatus()
        Analyzes the board to determine the game state. That state is then returned as a character. The game is over if either player has completed a row, column, diagonal, or if the board is completely filled with no one acheiving victory.
        Returns:
        A character indicating the game state: '?' if the game isn't over, 'T' if it is a tie, or, if there is a victory, the winning player's symbol.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a textual represntation of the game board.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string represnation of the board.

      • playSingleGame

        public char playSingleGame()
        Plays a game of tic-tac-toe. The first player to play is chosen at random.
        Returns:
        A character representing the result of the game: 'H' if the human won, 'C' if the cpu won, 'T' if the game tied, and 'Q' if the human quit the game.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs tic-tac-toe games continuously until the user quits. Upon quitting, the statistics of the session are printed.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments are not used.
